Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Jason H
Reviews.Content: It was clean, the staff was friendly and it was close to the beach and boardwalk. On top of that when we got home we had a message that one of us had left an IPod touch in the room. I called and the staff was very helpful, when I asked if they would mail it to us they didn't hesitate to say yes. I expected it to come to us in an envelope, instead it was bubble wrapped and in a box. Truly show that staff is dedicated and cares about the customers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nana1Woodbury_nj
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night while looking for property in the area. The hotel was clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable. Close to beach, we didn't use the pool which was located on the second floor. Breakfast was free and adequate. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location , nice motel”
Reviews.Author: AllentownBarkley
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel just a short block from the beach and boardwalk. Large clean rooms and a nice breakfast. Free wifi is poor but there is internet access is available in the lobby. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: Janine K
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has a great location to the beach and board walk. It is fairly inexpensive and offers free breakfast. The location is great ,a short walk to the beach and the entertainment distric on the board walk. The staff is very friendly. We have stayed here for the last 3 years during the first weekend in Aug. the only complaint is noisey neighbors and we figured you would get that at any hotel. Every room has it's own balcony also. The best room is on the corner of the building where the balcony wraps around the corner and you only have one neighbor on side since your at the end of the hallway.

Reviews.Title: “Location is good, Rooms are spacious, and Staff are helpful”
Reviews.Author: bhojo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right off route 50, and is one street across from the boardwalk, near the southern end of Ocean City. There always seemed to be vacancy in this hotel, so for that reason we did not have much trouble parking, but if the hotel had more guests I can see how easily parking could be a problem if you were going in a massive car. The rooms at the front of the hotel are not actually ocean view, as the views are obstructed by other hotels, unless you get the King room at the top floor. Rather, the rooms at the side offer a glimpse of the ocean and the bay, if you are into watching sunrises and sunsets (though our night stay was cloudy). The hotel staff were always helpful, and offered us suggestions on places to go for dinner. The rooms are spacious and clean. I did not get to use the swimming pool nor the fitness room so I cannot comment on those, but the swimming pool is quite clean, and has a maximum depth of 4 feet. The breakfast service is named modestly as "continental", though it also includes waffles (that you can make with a waffle maker), hard boiled eggs, and sausage patties. Overall, our stay was good and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep Inn - Stay out Late”
Reviews.Author: lancaster4luvers
Reviews.Content: Great location, 1 block from beach. Rooms very nice and clean. Friendly desk, very helpful. Bus stop across the street. Close to board walk. Nice breakfast but only one toaster and waffle maker, so you have to wait. Did have sauges patties and hard boil eggs. 7-11 next door for coffee drinkers and resturants all over walking distance. Can get cold beer / wine also in 7-11 in MD if you want an adult drink. Police everywhere, so it is safe. Parking was a little tight for pick ups or SUV. Pool was small and outside but clean. No ocean view but maybe a bay view on other side. Nice hotel for anyone. Would stay here again. Children enjoyed it. Down side people drive crazy, be careful crossing street. Seem to be right on busy intersection. there is a sandwhich shop in resturant.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: tropical_lover_86
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the weekend and picked the Sleep Inn because it was one of the few hotels that had a vacancy. We booked last minute and were pretty happy with it. The hotel was clean and we stayed on the fifth floor. The bathroom was very large. The breakfast was good and had a variety of items including waffles. The room was quiet and we really did not hear outside traffic at night. The location is the reason to stay here. It is very close to the boardwalk at first street. My biggest complaint is that the wifi does not work in the room. The parking lot is very small and with an SUV we found it challenging to park, but found an end spot where we could fit. I reccommend bringing a smaller car. Overall I think I would stay here again because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: James E
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Ocean City, MD and my family wanted to be close to the ocean and boardwalk, so we chose this Sleep Inn & Suites. As others have said, Carol at the front desk was very helpful and friendly. The other desk personnel seemed friendly, but when I informed the one guy that the pool was out of towels, he said he would take care of it, but new towels never appeared in the next twenty minutes we were there. Oh, the pool is REALLY small. The breakfast buffet was good, with the normal long lines for the waffle machine as to be expected at any hotel free breakfast. They kept it stocked and no complaints from me besides the wait for a waffle machine. The hotel is newer and was in good shape. The elevators were fast, and we never had to wait more than a minute for an elevator. Only a shower in our room (no tub), but it worked fine. We had a king bed and it was not comfortable at all, but the kids didn't complain about the pull-out sofa-bed. Balcony was nice, as we were on the fourth floor, side of the building, but closest room to the boardwalk. We could see the bay, as well as the ocean and boardwalk from the balcony. Air conditioning controls are wall mounted, which is much better than the older units with the controls on the air conditioner. The parking spots were really tight and people with larger vehicles had difficulty getting in/out of the parking spots. With everything so close, we didn't have to drive much, so it wasn't that big of a problem for us. Location is the real reason to stay here. Cross the super-busy street in front of the hotel, and you're a two minute walk away from the boardwalk. Crossing that super-busy street is a real pain though.... We were there on a Tuesday and the beach fireworks were literally across the street from the hotel, and I could have watched them from our balcony. If you're coming back from the beach, there's a garden hose on the left side of the hotel behind the side entrance, where you can wash off your beach sand. I didn't see it documented anywhere, but found it when walking back from the parking lot after using the stairs. I didn't notice any bad smells in the hotel like some other reviewers noted. Oh, I'd skip the neighboring steakhouse that the front desk recommends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeremey1982
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute post wedding trip. The hotel was clean and the rooms were nice. Since the weather was a little iffy, we spent a fair amount of time in the rooms. The cable provided a wide variety of channels and the AC work wonderfully. The only downside to the hotel is the smell in hallways was a little strong, but it never leaked into the room.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, not the worst”
Reviews.Author: rspeaker67
Reviews.Content: Just finished a 3-night stay here, was a last minute booking and the price was decent for what was described as a room with 2 pillow-top queen beds. Um, yeah, more on that later. First, the good points. Location, location, location. Walk out the front door, across the street, up 1 block and you are on the boardwalk at 1st street. Right in the heart of it all. The room itself was nice, with 2 beds, a chair, a desk, TV, and nice bathroom. Bathroom sink had granite countertop and shower had granite surround. Water pressure was good and the temperature consistent. Was a little surprised that they don't have flat screen HDTV yet but what they had worked well. Each room had a little balcony with chairs and table. Pool was small but nice, water was warm. The hotel offered a free breakfast each morning, free coffee all day in the next door bistro, and free internet access. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. Now the bad. The beds were pretty hard, and the "pillow top" was nothing more than a thin layer of padding under the sheet - nowhere near a true pillow top. The balconies are nice, but the doors and windows are not very sound resistant, so if your neighbors are out, you WILL hear them. The AC did not work right, I started the thermostat at 70 then dropped to 68, but the room temp never got below 72. The wired internet worked well, but the wireless stunk. We were on 3rd floor (out of 5) and the only place I could maintain a wireless signal was in the bathroom! Internet access required a passcode which wasn't readily available in the room and when I tried to call the front desk to get it, the phone didn't work. Parking. There are plenty of spots, but the lot is VERY TIGHT. I highly recommend driving a small car if you are staying here. We had nights with a full size pickup and/or an Escalade in the lot, and it was very hard to get through. Getting into and out of spots was difficult because people parked however and wherever they wanted, and hotel staff did not seem to mind. Cars were parked across 2 spots, were parked 2 feet back from the parking block, etc. Check your car daily for dings and scratches cuz there's a good chance you'll get one. By far, the worst experience was with housekeeping. We checked in Saturday and everything was fine. On Sunday, we were out of the room from 11 until 1:30 pm, then came back long enough to shower and change, then were out again from 2:15 until 8 pm. Room never got cleaned. Had to call front desk to get clean towels, more shampoo, etc. On Monday, we were out of the room starting at 10:45 and popped back in off and on from 2 until 3:30 and the room hadn't been cleaned yet. FInally we came back a little after 4 and it was done, but the housekeeping crew had taken our toothpaste. Since we were leaving the next day we got a couple of ready to use toothbrushes from the front desk, otherwise we would have had to go buy toothpaste. All in all it was an OK stay, the front desk was very responsive to the issues. I've just never stayed anywhere with that poor of housekeeping services. I would definitely consider staying here again but only if my top 20 choices are booked.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: cajeanpaul
Reviews.Content: The sleep inn is a good hotel for a reasonable price. It is not the fanciest, but the cable is decent to entertain the children and adults alike, the rooms are clean and comfortable with the exception of the bathroom- the shower doesn't drain properly leaving sand and other remains to stay in the tub. (The same thing happened the last time we stayed here. If this were changed, I would give this a 5 for the money and location). The fantastic thing about this place is the breakfast. It was not your traditional continental breakfast, they also provided waffles, sausage, boiled eggs, yogurt, etc. I was full and satisfied when I finished breakfast. Overall, we were satisfied here.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend away!”
Reviews.Author: Bevmom2
Reviews.Content: This motel is clean, spacious and the staff are very friendly and helpful. Thanks Carol for suggesting a great restaurant and after dinner cruise. The breakfast was plentiful and delicious and was even ready earlier then the scheduled opening time of 7am. The location is great, only half a block from the beach! We also took our bikes and enjoyed riding around town, it was much easier to get around on bike then to battle the traffic. We will definitely come back when we come to OC again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Location, and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Carol F
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a three-day, two-night stay at the Sleep Inn and Suites. It was our first time in Ocean City and definitely won't be the last. We had an awesome time. First of all, the location is perfect. Two blocks from the boardwalk and beach, it is in the middle of all the fun. There are ice cream shops, restaurants, drugstores, bike rentals, and lots of souvenir shops all within a 5 minute drive or less. I highly recommend On the Bay Seafood for succulent, delicious crab and OC Swirl for healthy tart frozen yogurt. Despite being so close to the action, this hotel was far enough away that it was very quiet. Second, the rooms (we had three) were all immaculately clean. Our rooms all had king beds and they were soft and very comfortable. There is a coffee maker in the bathroom, a table and chairs on the terrace, and a TV with plenty of channels. The TV is a bit old but it was big enough and worked fine. Third, the breakfast is awesome. There was a huge assortment. There's a waffle station, two different types of cereal, sausages, toast, fruits, hard-boiled eggs, and low-fat yogurt. For a free breakfast, this is more than what we expected. The hours are from 7-10 am, which I think is quite generous. They even kept it open a little later (until 10:15 or so) for stragglers to pick up some coffee and muffins. Fourth, the staff is awesome. They were kind, professional, and courteous. I originally booked a one night stay but then we decided to stay two nights. The prices online had increased by then so I called the hotel to press my luck. Not only did the woman (Carol) give me the online price ($190 instead of $200+) she also made it so that we wouldn't have to move to a different room (on account of technically having two separate reservations). We celebrated my dad's birthday a bit early and got him a gift. We forgot the wrapping paper and tape so I went to the front desk and grabbed some newspaper and the young man provided tape. Fifth, parking is plentiful and free. Not sure if free parking is the norm around these parts since this was our first time, but this isn't the case in many other areas so I did appreciate this. I'm usually hesitant to book hotels around beach areas. They are usually overpriced, dirty, and run-down. Not so with this establishment. Don't hesitate to pull the trigger and book. Our family will be back again at this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Just a hop, skip, and a jump away!”
Reviews.Author: OliviaLouann
Reviews.Content: I know that when I stay at a hotel, the main things I am concerned about are cleanliness and price. While it was a little expensive, the price was about the same as other hotels in the area. It is not beachfront and we could not see the ocean from our balcony, but the boardwalk is just a short walk away. I know it's difficult to decide exactly which end is the best to stay on. In my opinion, Sleep Inn is right in the middle of all the action. As for the hotel itself, the staff were incredibly nice and extremely helpful in finding the best crab for your money. Breakfast was sufficient, but not wonderful. They have the basics. The room was clean, which is really important, and the beds were fairly comfortable. My only complaint is that the parking is really tight. If you have an SUV, van, or truck, you may have some trouble parking. We tried to get a spot on the end of the lot, which wasn't always possible. However, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, just few minor mishaps”
Reviews.Author: vanh31
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Ocean City MD. I called a few places until I spoke with Carol who was Out of this world Fabulous! She gave us a great room on the corner of the top floor with a cute balcony that had a perfect view of the ocean across the way! Nonetheless a great price for our 2 night stay. She even went out the side door and showed us where the best restaurants were to go for dinner. Yes they were "WONDERFUL" The only mishaps I was not happy with was that the maids did not replenish our toiletries on the first night, and that I could not connect to their Free Wi FI until the last hour before we left. This was very frustrating.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in OC!”
Reviews.Author: CLHUMBLE
Reviews.Content: My two friends and I are currently staying at Sleep Inn. The room is very clean and the staff (Carol) is excellent. Thanks Carol for directing us to Crab Alley for lunch. We are enjoying our stay and would return to this hotel again. Rooms are nicely furnished, A/C works VERY well, nice balcony, large bathroom, clean beds and mini-fridge. It is a little pricey for my taste but appears to be a good value compared to the prices of other hotels in this area. Boardwalk is just a block away. Hotel offers complimentary breakfast but I haven't tried it yet.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: natalie211
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel from 7/13/2012-7/15/2012. After checking in, noticed that the hallways do NOT have a/c, it was stifling hot. Room seemed ok. Took my youngest daughter to the pool, came back to give her a bath. The water from both the tub faucet and shower head barely dribbled out. It literally took about 45 minutes to fill the tub up 1/2 way!! Next we noticed that the items we put in the mini fridge were still warm, despite being in the fridge for an hour. I went to the front desk to notify them that the fridge was not working. Someone came up about 3hrs later to look at it. The gentleman said that the fridge was not working and would be replaced the next morning. Saturday morning arrives, and after breakfast my youngest child bumped against the door, before we were able to slide the room key card, the door opened. Thinking I had not shut it tight, I firmly pulled it shut and I bumped against it to see if it would open. It did!! We had slept the entire night in the room with a door that did not lock! Then we noticed the tall lamp in the room which was turned on, started to smoke. I unplugged it right away, and went to the front desk to tell them about the door not locking and the lamp smoking. The youngman at the counter told me to " just put the lamp on the balcony, we'll look at it later". Sometime later that evening the door was fixed, the fridge was plugged back in and we were told "it was fixed" (it wasn't) the issue with the lamp never was never addressed. I noticed that we were just about out of toilet paper and asked a member of house keeping for more, when I was told that it was hotel policy that only one roll is given to each room for a weekend. WHAT?!?!? I had to drive to the store to buy toilet paper. We paid $300 a night, for a room that had a door that didn't lock, dribbling water from the tub, a broken fridge, a smoking lamp, and no toilet paper. Just a horrible and frustrating stay. I will NEVER go back to this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room”
Reviews.Author: Jay S
Reviews.Content: we happened upon Ocean City return back home and loved it so we had to stay. Sleep Inn was hotel we chose. Hotel is only a few years old so everything was new. one block off beach but excellent value for the area. Family run business so there seem to be an attention to the little things. Beds were excellent. Bathroom was nice and clean. Glad we stayed

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmf106
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel especially the location was excellent...Rooms are very clean and spacious... Our stay was wonderful and my kids loved it... We will always stay here when we come back to Ocean City...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but if you value your car”
Reviews.Author: Christina A
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at this hotel. When we checked in it was fast and the staff were friendly. We loved our room. It is very spacious and clean. The beds and even the pillows are comfy. The breakfast if yummy. I was very surpised at what they serve you. The only complaint I have is the parking. The lot is extremely SMALL. You have hardly any room to manuever. I am afraid someone will hit my truck. Other than the parking I have nothing but the best to say for this hotel. If they fix the parking or figure out some way of making the huge trucks park in one area while smaller vehicles park in another area I will be back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Silvia G
Reviews.Content: Excellent prices, excellent staff (thanks for everything Carol) & excellent room!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Price”
Reviews.Author: PKM99
Reviews.Content: The staff was exceptional. Free Breakfast and service was excellent. Rooms were pretty and clean. Road side rooms can be noisey, but entertaining. If you want quiet, ask when making reservations. Although it is not on the Boardwalk, it is our favorite hotel and first choice for Ocean City!

Reviews.Title: “OK place..”
Reviews.Author: Lisa F
Reviews.Content: We went off-season and the main thing that I had an issue with was the price. I felt it was terribly overpriced for off-season. The hotel itself was OK - nothing spectacular - since I had heard it was fairly new I had expected better. The room itself was kind of small - no where NEAR enough dresser drawer storage. Nice that it had the fridge. All and all - so-so.. Breakfast was also nothing special - the typical.. They could use another waffle maker. I'd stay here again due to the location during the bike week but I'd get a better price. Interesting that they quoted us MUCH lower prices if we go back in Sept.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel near attractions”
Reviews.Author: terps101
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay here - room was clean and very roomy. The bathroom was huge with an interesting shower stall sunken into the wall - never seen one like that in motel. The Bed was very comfortable. We were within walking distance to many local attractions. Only negative was it was very noisy around 2:30 AM when people were coming home from the bars & clubs, Also some noise aroun 6:00 when the trash truck was making it's pickup. the room had a baloney but there was no view at all from the 2nd floor. The parking lot was extremely tight - I don't know what they do in season when the place is full - I could see you getting parked in by large vehicles Breakfast was just OK - Very limited compared to other sleep Inns Would probably stay here again - got a decent advance paid rate

Reviews.Title: “Second time, still a great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: tfunky
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sleep Inn for Ocean City's bike weekend and really enjoyed the hotel. My wife and I stayed here last year and this year was just as great. Rooms were clean, comfortable and a nice locations so we can walk to everything. The morning breakfest was simple and saved us a few dollars. We will be going back in 2012 for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Terrified and shocked!”
Reviews.Author: dhglass
Reviews.Content: Well my stay started out great,a friendly staff member and a clean room. The trouble started when a key to my room was given to a suspicious stranger that was looking for someone with the same first name as me. The desk clerk issued a key to this stranger and then he attempted to enter my room at 4 am. If it weren't for the chain lock I can't imagine what may have happened. The man was yelling at us and reaching in through the door opening , trying to unlock the chain. The cops were called and we were unharmed physically, but I will be uneasy about hotel stays for a long time. That's unfortunate because we stay about 70 nights a year in hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay in OC, MD”
Reviews.Author: Lauren4172
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with couples & friends for Bike Week & my best friend's wedding. This was our 3rd year going to Ocean City for Bike Week & this was by far the best hotel experience we've had overall. Along with being kind & pleasant, the staff was extremely accommodating & helpful. The housekeeping staff was wonderful as well; we always came back to a clean, refreshed room (turndown, new towels, etc.) Location was also great. It's about a block back from the beach/boardwalk, has a 7-11 about a minutes walking distance away & is close to various restaurants, stores etc. Overall, one of the best, if not the best, place to stay when visiting Ocean City! Will definitely be going back!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms. Great location for the boardwalk. I'm glad we stayed here.”
Reviews.Author: uh2_2u
Reviews.Content: After and initial room mix up (we were given a room that hadn't been services yet), things went smoothly. Parking is at a premium, but I was lucky to fit my HUGE rental in a tight spot. The bathroom was clean, everything worked as it should and I have no complaints. If you have kids or need close access to the start of the boardwalk, this hotel is perfect. You literally cross one street and there you are.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel,great location,would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: Kimlee301
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in a king suite, the room was very spacious, the bathroom was a nice size, very nice view from our balcony, very good location. The staff was very nice, whatever we needed they provided. The only thing stopping me from giving this hotel an excellent is the 2 person sofa was very, very uncomfortable, they really need to invest in better sofa's, however I would still stay there again but maybe in the double room.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good stay”
Reviews.Author: Behtah1220
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and spacious. Nice balcony. Great location and plenty of parking on site. This place was a nicer stay than some of the other hotels we've stayed at. Beds were good. Furniture is modern and bathrooms are very nice! Only con was the very, very small, tiny pool. No more 4 people can swim in it at one time and that's about over crowded. The carpet also had a stench to it like stinky feet. Nasty! It wouldn't hurt to deodorize those carpets!! Other than tha it was a pretty good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: laTrendae
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sleep Inn and Suites in Ocean. We visit OC yearly and found that we needed to book early to get the best hotel rooms. We have stayed in some God awful places in OC but to my surprise I have absolutely nothing bad to say about Sleep Inn and Suites. I booked several months in advance and also paid in advance. The hotel is only one block away from OC beach and boardwalk. Check in was a little hectic but sometimes that is to be expected. No real complaint about that. The room was very big and very clean. The restroom was also very big and roomy. We had a balcony that overlooked a small pool on the second floor. There were lots of families and lots of couples but there we no wild and crazy young people running thru the hotel. No loud talking and heavy traffic during all hours of the night. It was great! Parking was no problem. There was ample free parking in the rear of the hotel. No driving around city blocks frantically searching for a parking space. The location was great, close to the hot spot of the boardwalk and close to the beach, close to great restaurants and shops. Loved every minute of the stay and surprisingly have nothing bad at all to say. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, but won't make your vacation any more enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: mrkillie
Reviews.Content: Got into room and had 1/4 roll of toilet paper (if that much) with no replacement roll; about 5 tissues in the box; no bedding for the pullout bed; too few towels. Continental breakfast had limited choices - including frozen bagels. There was 1 toaster available for a hotel full of guests. Claim to change bedding every day unless requested otherwise, but they didn't. Front desk staff did address all issues they were made aware of in a tmely manner.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Bearcub04
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. It was very clean and super friendly! We had a small view of the ocean from our balcony which was nice. The bathroom was very clean which is very important to me. The rug did have a few stains but that can't be helped when you have all kinds of people that don't care about how they treat hotel rooms. I would definatly stay here again. Close to the boardwalk and beach. Parking was not a problem like some people stated. The breakfast was just enough, I mean it filled my kids bellies and they liked getting and making thier own toast or bagel. As far as the pool, it is small but most of the time nobody was in it, so when we came back from the beach every day we went to the pool for an hour or so as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean rooms, good value”
Reviews.Author: SwannTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in mid-June 2011 for a one-night getaway to Ocean City. The location was great - just a block from the boardwalk. Rooms were clean and we could see the ocean (barely!) from our balcony. We didn't use the pool during our stay. The staff were competent and friendly, but service was just a bit slow (mainly due to customers, not to the staff). Breakfast is basic - toast, cereal, oatmeal, etc. We were only in town one night so we gave it a miss and went out for a nice brunch instead. Our room was clean and was nice to have a fridge to store some fruit, juice, etc. Overall, was good value and would consider staying here again if we go back to Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “An averege sleep inn”
Reviews.Author: babbytravel87
Reviews.Content: Well, My husband and I went for 6 days to Maryland to visit his parents. My husband's parents own a very small house so we made arrangments at the sleep inn. It was okay but not amazing. The rooms were very small and the bed was a king and it was the same size as a queen. It also wasent that clean i found some mold spots in the shower so i called the front desk and housekeeping came up and cleaned it. The service was very nice and accomidating and they helped us with all of our needs. The pool was very small and the week we went was very crowded so there was no room to sit and sun tan by the pool. (we were better of at the beach anyway.) Also the breakfast was good they had good waffles and many cereals to choose from! But in all this hotel was pretty averege. When we come back to Maryland next year we will be staying at a nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: vaughnsuit
Reviews.Content: Great location, only 1 block from Boardwalk. Hotel is easy to find and has free internet and parking. Our room even had a partial ocean view and huge balcony. Carol at the front desk was very helpful and friendly. Gave us great recommendations for area restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: jcraig10
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night. The room was clean, except on one of the pillows there were some stains (looked like maybe from makeup) but I wasn't too worried about it since we had 3 other pillows that looked fine. Our shower was a bit odd, it sort of had a hallway inside the shower and the showerhead was tucked back in the corner...sort of hard to explain unless you see it! The bed was comfy and the bathroom was spacious...huge counter! Although the coffee pot was in the bathroom which I thought was interesting. Good thing I read the reviews on here before we went though...we were planning on taking our 4 door long bed pick up truck but after reading that the parking lot was tight we decided to take our compact car....great idea because the parking lot really is VERY VERY TIGHT!!!! it was tight even for my 2 dr car. The lady at the front desk was very polite, but it took quite a while to check in...she seemed sort of preoccupied. Great location!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location, HORRIBLE mattress!”
Reviews.Author: blucas74
Reviews.Content: Our overall stay was good. The price was right, it was a clean property, free breakfast was decent, and the staff was great! The room was a good size and it had a huge balcony. The only down side to the balcony was that is was right on the road so we could hear every car that drove by. Thank goodness we were there in the off season. If you are staying in the summer, I would be sure to ask for a room that is not on the street side. The location was prime....a 2 minute walk to the boardwalk! The only bad part of the stay were the beds...the mattresses sagged to the middle and from top to bottom which made sleeping uncomfortable and difficult. Both beds in the room suffered from this problem...hard to believe since the property is only 2 years young.

Reviews.Title: “Its a good hotel, but not great”
Reviews.Author: Melb33
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to be impressed by the Sleep Inn, given that it is only two years old. I know that Ocean City hotels charge exorbitant rates for less than average accommodations for the most part, so a brand new chain hotel should be a refreshing change, we thought. Pros: NO BEDBUGS! First thing I did was lift up the sheets and inspect the mattress. NOTHING! Plus the sheets were exceptionally clean and crisp. Bed and pillows were comfortable as well. Overall, room was quite clean, save a few things mentioned in cons. GREAT location! Only a block off the boardwalk. Close to Sunfest (the reason for our weekend say) and a block from the carribean bar (so not far to stumble back! :-) ) Free on-site parking. Other have mentioned how small the spaces are. We had no problem putting the Jeep Wrangler in a covered spot (and leaving it there all weekend!). Plenty of spaces on-site to be had as well, unlike other hotels which have lots which are a block or two away. Cons: Walked in about three hourse before check-in. We did not expect to get into our room and merely wanted to let them know we were there and whether we needed a parking pass. The foreign gentlemen who came out of the office took my name and merely stated "come back at 3" Ok, no problem, but do we need a parking pass? "No just come back at 3." Great way to start the weekend?!?! We are AAA members. Therefore, our room is guaranteed until 7:00 a.m. the next day and only THEN should our card be charged. I got a call at 1:00 p.m. from Carol at the front desk asking if we were planning to come because "your card had not gone through and when that happens, people do not usually show up." Well, Carol, I was already there and informed your co-worker that I was there, so clearly Mr. Friendly did not impart that information. Also, the card I used has a low limit and was NOT TO BE CHARGED unless I did not show up. Ok, 3:00 p.m. comes, another gentleman at the front desk was exceptionally polite and friendly. Checked us in without problem or wait and up to the room we went. Overall, the room is large (king bed suite) and clean, save a few stray hairs behind the bathroom room from prior guest. Also, the floor of the shower stall could have used a good scrubbing and some bleach. The air conditioner needed re-set when we got there, which we did and it worked until sometime around midnight, when we could barely get it to pump out any cool air (and it was in the low 90's all weekend in OC). Also, was very disappointed in the free breakfast. Other chains will offer a few hot items or some hard boiled eggs. This breakfast consisted of juice, coffee, bread, mini muffins, some fruit, yogurt and cereal. The breakfast area was very clean and all items were fully stocked, but to keep up with other national chains, Sleep Inn should bump it up a bit. Overall, a totally average stay. For the price though, Sleep Inn should be a little better than average.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: tfunky
Reviews.Content: This hotel is now the best hotel I stayed at in Ocean City. A great balcony view, spacious room and very clean. I loved the close location to the boardwalk and beach as the hotel is located just a block off the boardwalk. A morning free breakfeast that includes bagels, cereal, coffe, juice and muffins is perfect to start your day. Don't hesitate to book your room, it's the best OC has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “A must read if you're planning on staying here. Reconsider!!!”
Reviews.Author: redlight40
Reviews.Content: I just got back from staying at this fairly new hotel with my husband & 2 children. I did my research and although there are some bad reviews on this site, most of them were positive so I felt pretty good making the reservation. I should have listened to the bad reviews. Pros: 1) Location is good if you want to be where all the action is i.e. boardwalk, near the inlet, etc. 2) If you can get a clean room (a big if), then the price isn't bad 3) The management did respond to some of my complaints which I will list below, but in my experience, it depends on who you get at the front desk Cons: 1) they wouldn't let us check in until 3 pm on the nose. This isn't that big of a deal except their reason was the cleaning crew only had from 11 - 3 to clean all of the rooms. This isn't true because not everyone checks out on the same day, therefore, they have time to clean rooms before 11 and after 3. Also, if they clean a room at 11 and get done at 12, that room is available and the front staff just doesn't want to be bothered figuring out which rooms are done for the convenience of their new guests 2) the parking lot is very tight - not just the width but the length, so larger cars and trucks were sticking out making it tight to manuever 3) the first thing that hit us in the room was a bad odor that was partially masked by some kind of spray, which made it worse. We realized later that this was partially due to the previous guest who used the microwave and the cleaning crew didn't clean it. It had a bunch of melted butter/grease that was clearly part of some seafood that was in there. It was gross. 4) we booked a 1 room king suite which is really just a big room with a couch and table. They also gave us a room that had a view of the bay (not the ocean) and the tiny pool (which was cold). Plus our room was on the side with the SMALL balancy's. They were so tiny they are almost pointless and ours had no tiny plastic chairs like the other ones did. We called the front desk and asked for 1 and some more towels, and 50 minutes later had to call again. They brought the towels but forgot the chair, but we finally got 1. - we were in room 423 on the 4th floor 5 the sofabed still had the previous guests sheets and blankets on it. When I took them off, there was spots of blood on the mattress. Not a lot of blood, but any blood is bad, don't you think? When I told the front desk, they gave me a new mattress pad to put on it. Um, that helped, but I think a new mattress or a new room would have been better. 6)when the cleaning crew came to clean our room, they didn't make up the sofa bed nor did they vacuum! They only made our bed and restocked our towels. They missed restocking the tissues which was just annoying after all the other problems. 7)the exercise room was very hot when I walked into it, and like another person posted in their review, only 1 of the 3 machines was working. They claimed somone stole the cables, but how hard is it to order new ones. Plus there were no cups for the water jug. If were staying longer than 2 nights, I would have demanded a new room (although they told me they were full) or checked out. In any case, during checkout, the manager on duty gave us a 20% discount for the problems. This helped, but did not wash away our bad experience. He said that they recently had some staff issues (specifically on the 4th floor btw) and they are trying to fix them, but there were so many issues it's hard to overlook them. My advice is to pay a little extra and get the prepay rates at the new Marriott only a few blocks down which is oceanfront btw.

Reviews.Title: “Clean place in good location - a MUST stay if your 1st time in Ocean City MD”
Reviews.Author: chochrei
Reviews.Content: Had friends going to Ocean City who invited us to come along, we had never been there and while looking for hotels I got a little concerned with some of the reviews. Seemed many places are a little older and the rooms are getting run down. Without knowing where to go I found this place online and was more happy reading the reviews that it was newer with clean then worrying about the reviews complaining about the staff. The place was new and everything was nice and clean. Driving down the main road you can see that Ocean City is aged, many hotels that are in drastic need of renovations. The location was great too. We were on the 3rd floor and didn't have any ocean view, not sure if the 4th or 5th floors can see over the building across the street. We didn't go to the pool, so I couldn't say how nice that was. The location was great, step right across the street and your at the boardwalk in the middle of everything! I would definitely recommend this hotel and stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “nice + clean”
Reviews.Author: lovesw87
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend for 2 nights. Check in time was at 3. We got there pretty early..1ish. Went to the front desk to see if they could check us in before 3. Front desk said they couldnt do it at that time but we can try around 2:30. But she mentioned we could park at their parking lot right now. So that was good enough for us. We left our stuff in the car..walked around boardwalk. The hotel was decent. Our room was NICE and CLEAN. Bathroom was good size and thumps up for cleaniness. Downside was the beds. In my opinion, the bed wasnt comfortable. My back hurts right on the first day i slept on it. But then again, I like to sleep in my bed. Happens a lot when i sleep somewhere else. LOCATION was great! One block away from boardwalk. BREAKFAST was ...simple..With the price i paid for the room and quality. I expected more. But oh well. The BIGGEST thing i wanted to mention was the indoor pool they have! First of all, they said heated indoor pool....WRONG!! indoor? it was outside! I was very dissapointed bc i knew when i was heading down to OC, the weather was going to be horrible, rainning all weekend. So i thought we could at least spend at our hotel indoor pool. But the pool was actually outside of their balcony 2nd fl. Since it was raining, we coulnt get to used it either!! The next day it was cloudy. I decided to at least be in warm heated pool instead of the beach. The water in the pool was COLD!! huh...I thought the hotel description said it was INDOOR HEATED pool. double dissapointed!!! and it was small! the motel next to us was bigger other than that, it was good. Front desk was friendly. If your looking for somewhere clean and good location. Here it is. But i would probably try somewhere else next time

Reviews.Title: “Ready to make another reservation for next year!!”
Reviews.Author: meggus
Reviews.Content: This place was fabulous!! Only complaint was that they only give you 1 trash can...the place was very clean (well, maybe except for the carpets..they were pretty stained), the staff was exceptional - they all went out of their way to make our stay more enjoyable. Location is great, breakfast worked well for us....

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for OC”
Reviews.Author: traveler533_9
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel with great rooms and staff. Ask for a AAA discount. The rooms are clean with a lot of if not all having a balcony. The pool is small and the gym is only three machines, but otherwise for Ocean City its a good place. There's a also a laundry room that guests can use. Its one block from the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean”
Reviews.Author: m29jackson
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean and spacious. Each room has a nice size balcony with a small table and two chairs. The bathroom was very clean. Wireless internet was fast. The continental breakfast wasnt all that great muffins, toast, cereal etc. But you have to get there early by 9:30 its practically nothing left. Its a great location, very close to the boardwalk, not noisy at night. The parking lot is very tiny and the pool is really small. The only problem I had was at they told me my credit card wouldnt be charged and it was before i could check in and at check out I wanted to use two different cards and the clerk got confused and told me she split it up but put it all on my debit card. Overall, for the price it was a grat stay and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new, great place”
Reviews.Author: postie94
Reviews.Content: Brand new hotel and a great place to stay! Complimentary breakfast, which is nothing huge, but enough to fill you! Clean rooms and balconies in every room! Very nice stay! Will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Cant beat the price for the quality and location!!!”
Reviews.Author: afm928
Reviews.Content: Had an absolutely terrific time.We stayed 4 nights. Very close to boardwalk, clean. Izzy at front dest would go out of his way to make your stay wonderful. Couldn't ck in early, but cld park and change. Small dorm fridge, had to use cooler. Spotless bathroom. Pool was green. But I came to swim in the ocean, I have a pool at home! Do yourself a favor and stay here. Close to everything. Not much of a breakfast, could improve on that. If you want internet, make sure you take your owncable. Wireless internet was fast. Had a balcony room over the side street. Wasn't noisy. Small chairs on balcony. I would absolutely stay here next year.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE”
Reviews.Author: beez090
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice and clean,walk across rd to beach.pool kinda small, right on boardwalk. carol at front desk is super.when making rev. ask for her.whole staff real nice,but she is super.

Reviews.Title: “It's Okay...but”
Reviews.Author: DaniMD
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to the action...too close. Bus runs all night, kids party in the street, fire/police screem by. Yes it's close to downtown, about one and half blocks off the boardwalk. So price alone, this is a pretty good value. The rooms are clean and neat. The free breakfast isnt anything to write about (cold ceral, fruit bagels, yogurt). The desk service was friendly but distant. The pool is just larger than a postal stamp, but not to be out done the parking lot is so tight, you almost need some one on every corner of your car to watch for you. The house keeping staff is equally distant, mainly because they see like they are from Russia, or like points. In room internet is also a myth. WiFi is available in the lobby (1 computer) and you need a desk cable for the room, if available. We couldnt get it to connect. There is also a lack of quality restaurants in walking distance of the hotel. Would I recommend it, no I dont think I can.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in 15 years of going to Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: teganlewis
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is only one year old and it is great. The room was clean, the bed was great, the guy at the desk helped out in any way possible. I am glad we found a place that was clean for once.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but good value.”
Reviews.Author: Renech
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night prior to moving to a bigger hotel. We were arriving very late (after midnight) and I wanted someplace not too expensive for just the one night. The late night check-in was friendly and efficient, and the room was pretty much as expected - clean and sufficient. No complaints at all. Perfect if you are looking for a no-frills, good value, clean hotel in a good location. We did not take advantage of the free breakfast, but it was offered.

Reviews.Title: “New, affordable, clean, and awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: Didojen
Reviews.Content: Let me just note that by no means is this a 5* hotel but I gave it 5* because it is exactly as described and so much better than expected. The hotel is immaculate. Rooms were large and clean. We did not have a bathtub in our room, not sure if this is the same for all rooms. Beds were comfy. We had a fridge, microwave, iron/ironing board, soaps and shampoos but no safe. We had a decent size balcony with a small table. We were able to see the beach from our balcony. There is also a laundry room if you need. No WiFi in rooms as others have stated as well. Free breakfast in the morning was nice (7am-10am). They had juices, coffee, toast, bagels, cereals, and some fruits. Not tons of food but can't complain, it was free! Seating was hit or miss though. One day we couldn't find a table, the next day it was completely empty (at about the same time 9am). Rates were very affordable for the location. We were only a block to the beach and extremely close to the amusement rides on the pier and Trimpers. Baltimore Ave is a little tough to cross with all the traffic. We found it a little easier to walk a block to the left or right to cross at the lights. Parking was tight (short, tight spaces - good luck parking an SUV) but ample. There were even a few covered spots under the hotel. We didn't use the pool so can't comment on that. This is such a pleasant addition to Ocean City where even the most run-down dumps are $300 a night. We will definitely stay here again when in the area and would without a doubt recommend to family and friends. Hope they maintain the hotel because it really is excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Price!!!”
Reviews.Author: RunawayRapunzel
Reviews.Content: Pros: First of all great location, we could walk right out cross the street and be at the activities end of the boardwalk. All new and very clean. Contrary to previous posts, our staff was wonderful....although we could not check-in early, which is fine, he allowed us a parking pass and showed us where the changing rooms were so that we could hit the beach until it was time. Cons: I wish I would have looked at the photos closer, because the suites are really jr. suites....there is no seperate bedroom, which we paid extra for to have a little privacy from the kids. No wireless internet that they advertise and have instructions for in their room booklet. =/ All in all great place!!!!! Those complaining about parking sizes, they are small but that is the norm at the beach, and I was glad to have parking that I didn't have to pay extra.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised...”
Reviews.Author: fuerte20
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Ocean City for Memorial Day and stayed at the Sleep Inn and Suites. Hotel is in new condition. Contrary to other reviewers, hotel front desk was very helpful...didn't experience any rudeness at all. Hotel is a block from the boardwalk, situated on busy Baltimore Ave, right past Rte 50. Parking at the hotel is off-street and tight (spaces are small); would recommend bringing a compact car if you have one, We saw plenty of people with larger vehicles, however. Hotel is situated at the more interesting end of the boardwalk, near all of the carnival rides, fishing pier, and tourist trap stores/snack stands. Our room was on the 5th floor, and still smelled new. Was very clean with small balcony. Hotel is L-shaped and our room faced the the inside of the hotel/pool (not beach/boardwalk), which wasn't bad because it buffered the noise from the bikers on Baltimore Ave all night long. Hotel bathroom was nice with granite on counters/shower surround. Hotel breakfast was typical continental fare...juices/coffee, cereal, bagels, and muffins. There was no restaurant/bar, however it appeared that they were in the process of building a cafe on the first floor. There are so many different restaurants/bars/clubs in OC...no reason to eat at at the Sleep Inn, anyway. Compared to some of the trashy motels around OC, this was a pleasant surprise. If you can't get a room at the Hilton, and don't mind being off the beach by one block, this is not a bad alternative. AAA discount saved us some money on the room, also.

Reviews.Title: “we WILL stay here again”
Reviews.Author: justus58
Reviews.Content: the staff was very pleasant and helpful. Our room was clean, quiet, bed was very comfortable. my husband and I will be staying there again in sept.2010.

Reviews.Title: “clean place, soft beds...”
Reviews.Author: retired1075
Reviews.Content: retired traveler, stopped by on my way to Florida. found this place a nice stop. Staid for weekend and it was so clean and staff friendly. Felt like family in a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: donq1113
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with the staff at check in. Hotel has a beautiful lobby. The Room was great. Had a great time. I would stay there every time I am in Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “RUDE FRONT DESK CLERK”
Reviews.Author: baseballmom1238
Reviews.Content: Upon check-inn the front desk clerk was rude and very unprofessional to the party of four i traveled with, her attitude continued throughout our 3 day stay, she represents the hotel! On our last night we were subjected to a group of guys drinking,yelling and using profanity until 3am,when we contacted the front desk we were told there was nothing they could do about it...yes the same desk clerk, we told her we would not return to the sleep inn and she shrugged and said its your choice, it was disturbing to stay at a beautiful hotel that is ran in the manner that this one is, on the positive side the housekeeping staff went above and beyond their jobs!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice addition to OC”
Reviews.Author: delawaredan
Reviews.Content: We’re frequent visitors to Ocean City, and we usually stay at hotels south of 16th street. Unfortunately, most of the hotels in that area are old and or very expensive. I was excited to see a new reasonably priced hotel. The Sleep Inn delivered. The room was clean, reasonably priced, and the staff was friendly. It doesn't have high end appointments (in fact they're a little cheap), but how important is that at the beach?? All I want is a clean place and a great location. This is at the top of my list for my next visit to OC.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Parking”
Reviews.Author: damiedzinski
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was very nice. Perfect location. It is still new, The rooms were a good size. We had a nice sized balcony, but the room next to us had one that was about half the size. The parking lot was poor planned in my opinion. Good luck if you have a big truck or van.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: hoteruguy
Reviews.Content: i went to ocean city with my fionce' and my sister for a day vacation, stayed at this hotel, and it was brand new, the room was clean, plenty of parking but the staff was HORRIBLE. we tried to check in early, but our room wasn't ready, that was fine with me. the guest service agent did not greet us, not smile, nor tell us where anything is. (pool, parking etc.) Oh and breakfast...was gone, was not upkept. we decided just to go out to eat. The hotel itself is nice, but I belive the front desk staff is the center of attention..Maybe Choice Hotels can do a better job at teaching them some hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Love it. Will stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: summerocean4
Reviews.Content: This place is only half block away from boardwalk. Its very convenient. tons of parking space, free wireless internet (lobby), free breakfast. it says that there is a wireless internet in the room. this is not true. you have to ask for ethernet cable from the front desk. I was on the 5th floor. great ocean view with cute balcony. only one thing about this place that I don't like is the pool. it's very very small and it looks dirty. I dont need the pool anyway when I can be laying on the clean beach and swim in the ocean. I will definitely stay at this place again. I was going to stay at the local hotel but I am glad I didn't. People I talked to said that it's dirty and they don't really maintain the place well.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, seconds away from the beach!”
Reviews.Author: ilovemiami7
Reviews.Content: This place was great. I have never been to Ocean City and was having a difficult time finding a place with good reviews in our price range. I took a risk with this one because I didn't find many reviews on any sites...and it turns out it was because it was brand new (according to the previous review)! I agree with the previous reviewer, it appeared that many of the older moderately priced hotels were not well-maintained. The rooms were great, front desk was very nice, and continental breakfast was good. Great mattresses, patios, and tubs. It was the perfect distance from the beach ( a block away). I heard staying on the boardwalk was too loud. I was a little bothered that they had wireless internet listed in their room guide...but actually had ethernet cables (I guess they had it at first, then discontinued the service, maybe they are just transitioning). However, we spent so much time at beach it didn't matter at all. We were so happy! We will definitely will stay here on our next trip to Ocean City.

HotelInfo.Name: Sleep Inn & Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 11 N. Baltimore Ave., Ocean City, MD 21842
